1970337 THE CITIZENSHIP (AMENDMENT) ACT, 2005
NO. 32 OF 2005 [ 24th August, 2005.]
An Act further to amend the Citizenship Act, 1955.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Fifty- sixth Year of the Republic of India as follows:-
502527 1 Short title and commencement.-
1974337 1This Act may be called the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2005.
505568 2It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 28th day of June, 2005.
1302607 2 Amendment of section 2.- In section 2 of the Citizenship Act, 1955 (57 of 1955) (hereinafter referred to as the principal Act), in sub- section 1,-
994454 ifor clause (ee), the following clause shall be substituted, namely:- ' (ee)" overseas citizen of India" means a person registered as an overseas citizen of India by the Central Government under section 7A;';
1466568 iiclause (gg) shall be omitted.
614423 3Amendment of section 5.- In section 5 of the principal Act, in sub- section 1, in clause (g), for the words" two years", the words" one year" shall be substituted.
849737 4 Substitution of new section for section 7A.- For section 7A of the principal Act, the following section shall be substituted, namely:- " 7A. Registration of overseas citizens of India.- The Central Government may, subject to such conditions and restrictions as may be prescribed, on an application made in this behalf, register as an overseas citizen of India-
684590 aany person of full age and capacity,-
1065447 iwho is citizen of another country, but was a citizen of India at the time of, or at any time after, the commencement of the Constitution; or
1184382 iiwho is citizen of another country, but was eligible to become a citizen of India at the time of the commencement of the Constitution; or
640939 iiiwho is citizen of another country, but belonged to a territory that became part of India after the 15th day of August, 1947; or
807691 ivwho is a child or a grand- child of such a citizen; or
1240690 ba person, who is a minor child of a person mentioned in clause (a): Provided that no person, who is or had been a citizen of Pakistan, Bangladesh or such other country as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify, shall be eligible for registration as an overseas citizen of India.".
785416 5Omission of Fourth Schedule.- The Fourth Schedule to the principal Act shall be omitted.
19284 6 Repeal and saving.-
528052 1The Citizenship (Amendment) Ordinance, 2005 (Ord. 2 of 2005) is hereby repealed.
306556 2Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken under the principal Act, as amended by the said Ordinance, shall be deemed to have been done or taken under the principal Act, as amended by this Act. ----
T. K VISWANATHAN,
Secy. to the Govt. of India.
